solution_line_template: The salesman sold {num_sold_swap_meet} bags for {num_sold_swap_meet} bags x ${price_swap_meet}/bag = $<<{num_sold_swap_meet}*{price_swap_meet}={revenue_swap_meet}>>{revenue_swap_meet}
He sold {num_sold_department} more for {num_sold_department} bags x ${price_department}/bag = $<<{num_sold_department}*{price_department}={revenue_department}>>{revenue_department}
Thus far he has sold {num_sold_swap_meet} bags + {num_sold_department} bags = <<{num_sold_swap_meet}+{num_sold_department}={total_sold_so_far}>>{total_sold_so_far} bags
Therefore he sold {total_bags} bags - {total_sold_so_far} bags = <<{total_bags}-{total_sold_so_far}={num_remaining}>>{num_remaining} bags for $22 each
{num_remaining} bags were sold for {num_remaining} bags x ${price_remaining}/bag = $<<{num_remaining}*{price_remaining}={revenue_remaining}>>{revenue_remaining}
